com.linkedin.math.bigFloat
Class BigApfloatConverter

java.lang.Object
  com.linkedin.math.bigFloat.BigApfloatConverter

public class BigApfloatConverter
extends java.lang.Object

Algorithms to convert between BigFloat and Apfloat. The Apfloat radixes must be integral powers of 2 (2, 4, 8, 16 or 32).

Constructor Summary

          Construct a converter with 4 bits per digit.

          Construct a converter.

Method Detail

toApfloat

public static org.apfloat.Apfloat toApfloat(BigFloat from,
                                            int digitBits)
Convert a BigFloat to an Apfloat.

Parameters:
digitBits - the number of bits per digit in the resulting Apfloat
Returns:
the same number, represented as an Apfloat. Its precision is Apfloat.INFINITE, since it represents precisely the same number as the given BigFloat.

toBigFloat

public static BigFloat toBigFloat(org.apfloat.Apfloat from)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Convert an Apfloat to a BigFloat.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - from.radix() is > 35 or not an integral power of 2
